page.title: 15Block D7 (Cont)
page.content: ..local library,the post office as well as private dwelling houses. Directly north from the station runs{ {Furnace Terrace}_the name of which is derived from it being built on the site of the old Pontyberem Iron Works, which supplied cannon balls to the British Army during the Napoleonic Wars.But owing to the slump that followed that war,the works were closed down.Most of the houses of the terrace are privately owned.About 200 yards along the road stands {New Lodge {Inn},above which is located a post_war Council housing Estate{Grugos Avenue}. Opposite this estate stands the Valleys' only Roman Catholic Church. Near the station in Pontyberem's Boxing Club,a club of recent origin but which has already no less than{5 {Welsh Junior Champions}. Behind this club is a field known....
